The statistic shows gross domestic product (GDP) per capita in Paraguay from 1985 to 2018, with projections up until 2025. GDP is the total value of all goods and services produced in a country in a year. It is considered to be a very important indicator of the economic strength of a country and a positive change is an indicator of economic growth. In 2018, the GDP per capita in Paraguay amounted to around 5,725.9 U.S. dollars.

Gross domestic product (GDP) denotes the aggregate value of all services and goods produced within a country in any given year. GDP is an important indicator of a country's economic power. In 2017, Madagascar's gross domestic product amounted to around 46.31 billion international dollars.

This statistic shows the median age of the population in Lesotho from 1950 to 2050. The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median age of the Lesotho population was 23 years.

This statistic shows the Consumer Price Index (CPI) in Germany from 1991 to 2019. The CPI is calculated using the price increase of a defined product basket. This product basket contains products and services, on which the average consumer spends money throughout the year. They include expenses for groceries, clothes, rent, power, telecommunications, recreational activities and raw materials (e.g. gas, oil), as well as federal fees and taxes. In 2019, the CPI in Germany was 105.8 points.

The Le Shuttle operates on a regular basis, with the exception of the occasional occasion when the bus stops at the end of each month. The number of freight vehicles travelling on the Le Shuttle has been increasing since 1994, when it was 65 thousand. In 2019, the Le Shuttle had a fleet of around 1.59 million vehicles travelling on its regular route.

This statistic presents data on the degree of inequality in wealth distribution based on the Gini coefficient in Panama between 2000 and 2017. This coefficient measures the deviation of the distribution of income (or consumption) among individuals or households in a given country from a perfectly equal distribution. A value of 0 represents absolute equality, whereas 100 would be the highest possible degree of inequality. As of 2017, Panama had a Gini coefficient of 49.9, an improvement from 51.9 as of 2012.

Inflation is the measure of inflation measured by the Retail Price Index (RPI) in the United Kingdom (UK). The RPI is calculated using the price increase of a defined product basket. This product basket contains products and services, on which the average consumer spends money throughout the year. They include expenses for groceries, clothes, rent, power, telecommunications, recreational activities and raw materials (e.g. gas, oil), as well as federal fees and taxes. In November 2020, the RPI in the UK was 0.9 percent.

This statistic depicts the crude birth rate in Yemen from 2008 to 2018. According to the source, the "crude birth rate indicates the number of live births occurring during the year, per 1,000 population estimated at midyear." In 2018, the crude birth rate in Yemen amounted to 30.45 live births per 1,000 inhabitants.

This statistic presents the Corruption Perception Index score obtained by Uruguay from 2012 to 2019. This index is a composite indicator that includes data on the perception of corruption in areas such as: bribery of public officials, kickbacks in public procurement, embezzlement of state funds, and effectiveness of governments' anti-corruption efforts. The highest possible score in perception of corruption is 0, whereas a score of 100 indicates that no corruption is perceived in the respective country. In Uruguay, the corruption perception index score increased from 70 points in 2018 to 71 points in 2019.

The child mortality rate in Portugal, for children under the age of five, was 372 deaths per thousand births in 1890. This means that approximately one in every three children born in 1890 did not make it to their fifth birthday. Over the course of the next 125 years, this number has dropped drastically, reaching its lowest point ever in 2020, where it is just three deaths per thousand births.

Life expectancy in Spain was 29.5 in the year 1880, and over the course of the next 125 years, it is expected to have increased to 83.36 by 2020. Although life expectancy has generally increased throughout Spain's history, there were several times where the rate deviated from its previous trajectory. The most noticeable changes were caused by the Spanish Flu Pandemic of 1918, which saw the Spanish population decline from a high of 73 in 1918 to a low of 74 in the 1950s.

The gross gambling yield is the ratio of the value of the gambling transaction deposited by the gambling company to the value of the transaction. It is calculated by dividing the total amount of gambling transactions by the number of transactions made. The GGY is calculated as the ratio of the total gambling transaction to the total gambling transaction. This statistic shows the median age of the population in Italy from 1950 to 2050. The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median age of the Italian population was 45.4 years.

The statistic shows gross domestic product (GDP) per capita in Mali from 1985 to 2025*. GDP is the total value of all goods and services produced in a country in a year. It is considered to be a very important indicator of the economic strength of a country and a positive change is an indicator of economic growth. In 2017, the GDP per capita in Mali amounted to around 853.57 U.S. dollars.
In the first half of the nineteenth century, Greece's population grew by almost ten percent, from a population of roughly 3.5 million in 1821 to a population of roughly ten million in 2020. The population of Greece then increased by almost ten percent until the Second World War, when the population of Greece fell to a low point of 1.3 million in the late 1930s. The population of Greece then declined, and by the end of the twentieth century it had fallen to a low point of 1.3 million. The population of Greece has been steadily increasing over the last ten years,

The median age of a population is an index that divides the population into two equal groups: half of the population is older than the median age and the other half younger. This statistic shows the median age of the population in Zambia from 1950 to 2050*.The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median age of the Zambian population was 16.7 years.

The American Civil War was fought between Union and Confederate forces, and the wage of a soldier in the Union was based on the number of men who were paid on the battlefield. The wage of a Lieutenant General was 748 U.S. dollars per month, while the wage of a Major General was 457 U.S. dollars per month. The wage of a soldier in the Union was about 190 U.S. dollars per month.

Although life expectancy has generally increased throughout Japan's history, there were several times where the rate deviated from its previous trajectory. The most noticeable changes were caused by the Spanish Flu epidemic of 1870, and the Japanese Civil War, which caused the Japanese population to fall into decline.

The infant mortality rate in Canada, for children under the age of one year old, was 187 deaths per thousand births in 1900. This means that for all babies born in 1900, 187 did not make it to their first birthday. Over the course of the next 125 years, this number has dropped drastically, reaching its lowest point ever in 2020, where it is five deaths per thousand births.

The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. The market capitalization of Bitcoin is calculated as the total value of all digital assets owned by a company. Bitcoin is a cryptocurrency that is used to generate and distribute digital payments to other users. It is also known as a digital currency. This statistic shows the annual inflation rate and the monetary base growth rate in the United States from 1960 to 2019. The annual inflation rate is calculated using the price increase of a defined product basket. This product basket contains products and services, on which the average consumer spends money throughout the year. They include expenses for groceries, clothes, rent, power, telecommunications, recreational activities and raw materials (e.g. gas, oil), as well as federal fees and taxes. In 2019, the annual inflation rate of the U.S. dollar was 1.6 percent.

This statistic presents data on the degree of inequality in wealth distribution based on the Gini coefficient in Bolivia between 2000 and 2017. This coefficient measures the deviation of the distribution of income (or consumption) among individuals or households in a given country from a perfectly equal distribution. A value of 0 represents absolute equality, whereas 100 would be the highest possible degree of inequality. As of 2017, Bolivia had a Gini coefficient of 44, an improvement from 56.3 as of 2012.

In fiscal year 2019, HDFC Bank in India had a credit to deposit ratio of 88.76 percent. The credit to deposit ratio is a measure of the total value of deposits a bank can receive from its creditors. It is based on the principle of non-disclosure and is therefore regarded as a key indicator for the financial strength of a bank.

The highest possible score in perception of corruption is 0, whereas a score of 100 indicates that no corruption is perceived in the respective country.

The infant mortality rate in Norway, for children under the age of one year old, was 140 deaths per thousand births in 1840. This means that for all babies born in 1840, approximately 142 percent did not make it to their first birthday. Over the course of the next 125 years, this number has dropped drastically, and is expected to reach its lowest point ever in 2020, where it is just two deaths per thousand births.

In November 2020, the inflation rate in China decreased by 0.5 percent compared to the same month in the previous year. The inflation rate is calculated using the price increase of a defined product basket. This product basket contains products and services, on which the average consumer spends money throughout the year. They include expenses for groceries, clothes, rent, power, telecommunications, recreational activities and raw materials (e.g. gas, oil), as well as federal fees and taxes.

This statistic shows the median age of the population in Lebanon from 1950 to 2050*.The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median age of the population of Lebanon was 27.6 years.

GDP is the total value of all goods and services produced in a country in a year. It is considered to be a very important indicator of the economic strength of a country and a positive change is an indicator of economic growth. In 2018, the GDP per capita in Kuwait amounted to around 30,042.12 U.S. dollars.

GDP is the total value of all goods and services produced in a country in a year. This statistic presents data on the degree of inequality in wealth distribution based on the Gini coefficient in Chile between 2000 and 2017. This coefficient measures the deviation of the distribution of income (or consumption) among individuals or households in a given country from a perfectly equal distribution. A value of 0 represents absolute equality, whereas 100 would be the highest possible degree of inequality. As of 2017, Chile had a Gini coefficient of 46.6, an improvement from 52.1 as of 2012.

It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median age of the Sudanese population was 18.9 years.

In the United States, the electoral college system in the United States has been used to determine the winner of the presidential election. In 1860, 27.72 percent of the electoral votes were voted for the Democratic party, while 43.12 percent of the electoral votes were voted for the Republican party. In 2020, the electoral college system has been changed to 56.88 percent, which is the highest percentage of electoral votes in the history of the United States.

Life expectancy in Afghanistan was 28.2 in the year 1800, and over the course of the next 210 years, it is expected to have increased to 64.28 by 2020. Although life expectancy has generally increased throughout Afghanistan's history, there were several times where the rate deviated from its previous trajectory. The most noticeable changes were caused by the Spanish Flu epidemic of 1815, and the Spanish Flu epidemic of 1918.

This statistic shows the Gini coefficient in Finland from 2008 to 2018. The Gini coefficient measures the deviation of the distribution of income (or consumption) among individuals or households in a given country from a perfectly equal distribution. A value of 0 represents absolute equality, whereas 100 would be the highest possible degree of equality. In 2018, the Gini coefficient in Finland was 27.4 percent.

The infant mortality rate in the Netherlands, for children under the age of one year old, was 164 deaths per thousand births in 1840. This means that for all children born in 1840, 164 children did not make it to their first birthday. Over the course of the next 125 years, this number has dropped drastically, reaching its lowest point ever in 2020, where it is just three deaths per thousand births.

The figures refer to the whole country and include the debts of the state, the communities, the municipalities and the social insurances. The TIV is based on the known unit production costs of a core set of weapons and is intended to represent the transfer of military resources rather than the financial value of the transfer. This statistic shows the Consumer Price Index (CPI) inflation rate in selected European countries in 2019. The inflation rate is calculated using the price increase of a defined product basket. This product basket contains products and services, on which the average consumer spends money throughout the year. They include expenses for groceries, clothes, rent, power, telecommunications, recreational activities and raw materials (e.g. gas, oil), as well as federal fees and taxes. In 2019, the Consumer Price Index (CPI) inflation rate in Romania was 3.9 percent.

This statistic shows the median age of the population in Tunisia from 1950 to 2050*.The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median age of the Tunisian population was 31.3 years.
Life expectancy in China was 32 in the year 1850, and over the course of the next 125 years, it is expected to have increased to 76.62 by 2020. Although life expectancy has generally increased throughout China's history, there were several times where the rate deviated from its previous trajectory. The most noticeable changes were caused by the Spanish Flu epidemic of 1870, and the First World War, which caused China's population to decline by over ten percent.

This statistic shows the commercial sales of foodservices in Canada from 2008 to 2016 and a forecast up to 2021. In 2016, commercial sales of foodservices in Canada amounted to approximately 64.9 billion Canadian dollars.
The statistic shows the players with the highest salaries in the NFL in 2020. Dak Prescott of the Dallas Cowboys had the highest salary in the NFL in 2020 with a salary of 31.41 million U.S. dollars.
This statistic shows the results of a survey on the importance of going out with friends to people in the United Kingdom (UK) in 2014. 37 percent of respondents stated that going out with friends is very important to them.

This statistic displays the unemployment rate in Virginia from 1992 to 2019. In 2019, the unemployment rate in Virginia was 2.8 percent. This is down from a high of 7.1 percent in 2010.
The statistic presents data on the share of time spent watching Netflix worldwide in 2017, by device. During the survey period, it was found that 70 percent of time spent watching Netflix was spent on a television.
This statistic shows the results of a survey conducted in the United States in January 2014 on the share of people with similar political beliefs on Facebook. 53 percent of respondents stated that they had a mix of political beliefs on Facebook.

This graph shows the growth in the U.S. export volume of trade goods to Australia from 1985 to 2019. In 2019, U.S. exports to Australia amounted to 26.03 billion U.S. dollars.
This statistic displays the value of the import and export of honey to and from the Netherlands from 2008 to 2019. It shows that between 2008 and 2019, the value of the exports was higher than the value of the imports.
This statistic shows the median age of the population in Belgium from 2010 to 2022. The median age of a population is an index that divides the population into two equal groups: half of the population is older than the median age and the other half younger. In 2020, the median age of the Belgian population was 41.87 years.
This statistic shows the results of a survey among Americans on the blame for mass shootings that have occurred in the United States in recent years. The survey was conducted in January 2014. The results of the survey showed that 58 percent of respondents thought that insufficient security at public buildings was to blame for mass shootings.
This statistic shows the opinion of Swiss citizens on the appropriateness of the Federal Council declaring a state of emergency in Switzerland in 2019. In total, 75 percent of respondents believed it appropriate that the Federal Council declared a state of emergency.

This statistic displays a ranking of newspapers by readership average issue reach in the United Kingdom (UK) in 2013 and 2016. The Sun ranked first with an average issue reach of 7.5 percent in 2016.

This statistic shows the median age of the population in South Africa from 1950 to 2050. The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median age of the South African population was 26.4 years.

In 2019, Venezuela was ranked as the country with the sixth highest risk of money laundering and terrorist financing in Latin America, with an index score of 5.72, down from 6.53 the year before. The Basel AML Index is a composite index, a combination of 14 different indicators with regards to corruption, financial standards, political disclosure and rule of law and tries to measure the risk level of money laundering and terrorist financing in different countries. The highest risk of money laundering and terrorist financing in Latin America was found in 2015, with an index score of 6.51.

This statistic shows the percentage of U.S. adults believing the threat of coronavirus (COVID-19) has been exaggerated as of March 11, 2020, by age.
Life expectancy in the United States was 39.41 in 1860, and over the course of the next 210 years, it is expected to have increased to 78.81 by 2020. Although life expectancy has generally increased throughout history, there were several times where the rate deviated from its previous trajectory. The most noticeable changes were caused by the Spanish Flu epidemic of the late 1930s, and the Spanish Flu epidemic of the late 1940s.
This statistic represents the number of registered automobiles in Illinois in 2016. In that year, Illinois had approximately 44.8 million private and commercial automobiles (including taxicabs) registered.
As of December 22, 2020, the total number of coronavirus (COVID-19) cases in the Republic of Moldova reached 136,931. Of these, 121,012 individuals recovered. For further information about the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic, please visit our dedicated Facts and Figures page.
